importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Colombia recalled its ambassador to the United States, marking a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
The previous instance in which Colombia summoned its ambassador in July, indicating a pattern of escalating diplomatic actions over the past few months.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period immediately following President Trump's public accusations and tariff threats, during which tensions peaked and diplomatic actions were taken.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, marking a significant diplomatic escalation.
This is the second time in 2025 that Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington, following a similar move by the U.S. in July.

The dispute centers on allegations that the U.S. supported a plot to remove Colombian President Gustavo Petro from power, which Petro claims, and U.S. accusations that Petro is a drug trafficker encouraging drug production.
President Donald Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to end large-scale payments and subsidies to Colombia, citing drug trafficking concerns.
The U.S. has launched missile attacks on seven vessels it claims were involved in drug smuggling, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Petro accusing the U.S. of 'murdering' Colombian citizens.
A Colombian citizen aboard the latest vessel attacked was returned alive to Colombia, adding to the diplomatic sensitivity.
The U.S. administration announced plans to raise tariffs on Colombian goods starting the next day, threatening Colombia’s economy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, amid escalating diplomatic tensions over drug trafficking allegations, U.S. attacks on alleged smuggling vessels, and accusations of U.S. interference in Colombian politics. This action follows a previous mutual recall in July and comes after President Donald Trump accused Petro of being a drug trafficker, threatened to end subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods, and authorized missile strikes on seven vessels, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Petro accusing the U.S. of 'murdering' Colombian citizens.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
